question: You have been invited to attend an admissions interview for a prestigious college. Unfortunately, you cannot come at the proposed time due to a previous appointment. Write a letter to the admissions tutor and explain your position. In your letter:Introduce yourself and state your interest in the programApologize and offer to come at a different timeAsk how long the interview will be and if you will have to take an exam
text: I'm writing to express my regret for not being able to make the scheduled interview. Because I had an excruciating toothache that required me to schedule an appointment with a dentist, I had to cancel our meeting.

I transmit my apology for my awful health hazard which intersected with our meet up, so I would like to request you to consider another day or maybe I am ready after 3.00 pm today. In addition, I am quite capable of speaking up.

I'd also like to know how long our interview will be and whether there will be any examinations, such as written or computer-based. Will it be multiple choice questions or writing composition if it's any of them? If not, a panel level interview will be held; if so, how many panel members will be present? Is there a dress code that must be adhered to?
I look forward to hearing from you as soon as possible, and I appreciate your consideration.
